Summary I’m a seasoned high-tech marketing communicator, strategist, & planner.  
 
In my role as a Technology Evangelist for Intel I’ve spent more than a decade strengthening the street cred of my company, crafting and conveying innovation stories to worldwide audiences, and generating thousands of media hits in the process. 
 
I was an engineer before crossing over to marketing, so I speak fluent tech – from circuits to software. My passion is revealing the excitement around new innovations and weaving them into visions of a better future.  
 
I’m a strategic thinker and know that everything starts with the Big Picture. I also know that it doesn't end there – the devil is in the details of disciplined execution. I’ve been called a marketing Swiss Army Knife. I’m skilled in messaging, positioning, and creative direction. I’ve also led multi-disciplinary teams to execute complex projects, campaigns, events, and announcements. I like tackling challenges and optimizing ROI.  
 
I’m a team player. I love working with talented people -- they inspire me and keep me on my toes. I like being a trusted advisor to leaders and coaching team members to develop their skills. I’m also a bridge builder; where others see silos and competitors, I see common interests and collaborators.

Experience Sr. Marketing Manager & Technology Evangelist Intel Corporation January 2006  – Present (9 years 8 months) Santa Clara, California Strengthened Intel’s tech leadership reputation by evangelizing Intel Labs' vision and research for future computing technology. Led story & content development, breakthrough technology announcements, large-scale media events, and ongoing campaigns for research areas including microprocessors, user experience, education, parallel software, photonics, cloud computing, security, visual computing and Big Data analytics. Aligned communications between internal stakeholder groups and drove co-marketing efforts to maximize impact. Led additional marketing activities for Intel Labs Europe and for Intel’s international network of university research centers. Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation September 2003  –  January 2006  (2 years 5 months) Responsible for technology evangelism which helped to establish Intel as a leader in the field of silicon photonics. Co-developed marketing plans and led content development for numerous events and technology announcements. Formulated key messages, white papers, animations, presentation materials, and live demonstrations. Awarded the Intel Achievement Award (Intel’s highest honor) for this work. Sr. Research Engineer Intel Corporation April 2000  –  September 2003  (3 years 6 months) Responsible for software automation and demo development for Intel’s silicon photonics research group. Developed software to enable and accelerate lab experiments, administered lab computer network, and managed group intranet sites. Also developed interactive hardware and software technology demonstrations for executive keynotes. Technology Development Engineer Intel Corporation June 1998  –  April 2000  (1 year 11 months) Lab engineer for a fast growing optical R&D group. Designed group intranet website including JavaScript based GUIs, designed physical layout three generations of custom test chips containing optical experiments, and developed custom electrical packaging solutions for these test chips. Summary Experienced business professional with a history of bringing new products and technologies to market and delivering marketing programs that grow market share and profitability.  
 
Strategic, entrepreneurial thinker that leverages analytical business skills to produce business results.  
 
Consultative approach to customer engagement, listening to gain insight into pain points and opportunities, then mapping solutions and services to influence consideration and purchase decisions. 
 
Strengths include customer-centric focus and ability to understand implications of issues across the business enterprise, leveraging a background in manufacturing, business process reengineering, technical customer support and project management. 
 
Specialties:  
* Driving awareness of and demand for emerging products and technologies 
* Managing software technology definition, launch and ongoing generational innovations in a “startup environment” separate from the core business of the parent Fortune 500 company 
* Enabling sales generalists to close complex deals by conveying business and technical value details that maps directly to customer pain points 
* Translating business needs from end users, analysts and technology experts into product marketing requirements  
* Developing business cases to secure development funding 
* Defining business and pricing models for non-traditional revenue streams 
* Influencing customer consideration and purchase via inbound marketing (blog, webinar, SEO, podcasts, whitepapers)  Summary Experienced business professional with a history of bringing new products and technologies to market and delivering marketing programs that grow market share and profitability.

Summary DETAIL ORIENTED: David’s attention to detail is evident in the quality of the analysis and troubleshooting he does, documentation he produces, and the thoroughness of his work. As a business analyst, David methodically thinks of all possible use cases and scenarios and delivers comprehensive solutions."David is incredibly thorough and comprehensive in his deliverables. His work output is always highly organized, well documented, and timely. This detail was critical in building the systems required to meet the business needs." 
 
RESULTS ORIENTATION: David role models assuming responsibility and can be trusted to complete his deliverables with minimal follow-up. "Everything David does is with results in mind. He is always willing to engage in critical conversation, question decision making when appropriate, and demonstrating passion in whatever he sets out to achieve." 
 
QUALITY: David takes real pride in the quality of his work as he strives to reach the highest standards of excellence. David constantly seeks opportunities to define process improvements and embraces them when implemented. David’s customers’ and stakeholders' feedback consistently illustrates his commitment to quality. "Your clarity in … requirements and painstaking effort to review all the test cases and suggest improvement certainly helped me develop better work products." 
 
Miscellaneous quotes from stakeholders and colleagues: 
-- "David has demonstrated exceptional leadership qualities … focusing on end result, collaborating across teams, managing expectations very well, de-risking unknown situations, as well as working hard when his own input is needed." 
 
-- "I am really proud as I worked with one of the great minds. Being a Business Analysts, he will not only give me the requirements or functionalities, but also perfect algorithm to implement them. Not sure, how come a BA can think this much technical. Hats off to you David."

-- "Team player - a great asset to have on any team" Experience Digital Business Experience & B2B Content Manager Intel Corporation July 2015  – Present (2 months) Hillsboro, OR David is a Technical Project/Program Manager in Sales and Marketing IT responsible for the B2B secure content pipeline. Lead Business Systems Analyst /Process Lead Intel Corporation December 2014  –  July 2015  (8 months) Hillsboro, OR As the result of a reorg, David joined the program team responsible for delivering salesforce.com CRM to Intel's Sales and Marketing Organization. David's primary focus is on consumer and channel support (also known as post-sales support), ensuring an effective and efficient transition from the existing on-premise SAP-based CRM solution to salesforce.com's cloud-based service cloud solution. As the lead business analyst, David is responsible for ensuring that all functional areas are working together seamlessly to provide a cohesive design that delivers all necessary business functionality. As the process lead, David is responsible for helping steer his consumer and channel support business partners in the Sales and Marketing Organization towards industry-best-practice processes which align as much as possible with out-of-the-box salesforce.com capabilities. Business Systems Analyst/Scrummaster Intel Corporation January 2014  –  November 2014  (11 months) Beaverton, OR David was the IT representative for post-sales support in the Cloud CRM RFP process. He partnered with representatives from pre-sales support and business partners to create a detailed list of requirements and scoring criteria. David participated in multiple rounds of scoring of vendor responses and conducted deep dive reviews. When the team ultimately selected salesforce.com to transform Intel’s CRM processes and tools, his contributions provided confidence that the best decision was made. 
 
David worked with The Wharton School to facilitate a Field Application Project, writing and then analyzing the results of a survey sent to 3000 pre-sales stakeholders across Intel. That analysis helped define the next few years’ focus for pre-sales support tools. 
 
While providing sabbatical coverage for a colleague, David joined an inflight project to enable consumer webticketing and used his attention to detail to identify numerous technical gaps with the planned deployment. David worked across IT groups to develop a solution to transition from the legacy email webform tool to webticketing without customer impact, including working with worldwide product support engineers to identify and resolve a multitude of data quality issues. David’s efforts directly contributed to the successful deployment of the solution and resulted in his being awarded a GRA. 
 
Also as part of the sabbatical coverage, David joined a team trying to deploy an eGain-based knowledge management solution. David served as an embedded scrum coach, which quickly morphed into a full time ScrumMaster role. He brought direction to the team by developing a single prioritized list of needs to which the team could execute. David’s get well plan included working extensively with production support to enable effective L2 support, defining a methodical approach for responding to the tool’s numerous production outages, and prioritizing the paydown of significant technical debt. Product Manager (Scrum Product Owner) Intel Media January 2013  –  December 2013  (1 year) Santa Clara, California A one year rotation to Intel Media. 
 
David leveraged his extensive customer support business process and tools knowledge to deliver detailed business requirements to Intel Media’s AudienceCare team for their implementation of Salesforce.com, establishing himself as a knowledge expert for business colleagues as well as internal and outsourced technical teams. David also facilitated the Intel Media team’s own elucidation of requirements. David’s work supported the release of a ~3000 user beta test of Intel Media’s prototype. 
 
David capitalized on his position as a neutral, trusted advisor to Intel Media to influence the engineering team to adopt Intel’s proven BKM-based design, integrating with Intel’s systems of record. David did this by navigating the organizational dynamics, identifying pockets of entrenched resistance, and then using data and reason to demonstrate how his proposal best met the business and technical needs of the organization. In David's role as the Scrum Product Owner for the logistics team, David provided structure and created the action plan the team used to move from relative chaos to a functional, integrated, and enterprise-scale solution for forward and reverse direct-to-consumer logistics. Business Systems Analyst Intel Corporation May 2009  –  April 2013  (4 years) Hillsboro, Oregon David was an analyst on the team responsible for replacing Intel's PeopleSoft CRM-based solution with an SAP CRM-based solution for Intel's customer-facing call centers worldwide; once completed, the team then replaced Intel's custom-built OEM/ODM/ISV customer support tool with an SAP CRM-based solution. David had multiple responsibilities, including data migration, product master data, web portal, UI, and a major focus on email capabilities, both agent-facing and automated notifications. 
 
Leveraging his legacy technical & business process knowledge & expertise, David lead the email capability efforts.
